alert.note: Alert for Lee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 6:37PM EDT until further notice by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: .Slow moving thunderstorms have caused excessive rainfall. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Florida, including the following county, Lee. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 637 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cape Coral, Fort Myers, Iona, Matlacha Isles-Matlacha Shores, St. James City, Matlacha, Harlem Heights, McGregor, Cypress Lake, Lochmoor Waterway Estates, Pine Manor, Pine Island Center, Villas, Palmona Park, Punta Rassa, Saint James City, Whiskey Creek, Fort Myers Villas, Page Field Airport and Page Park. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
